alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 8:02AM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Developing This Morning... .A band of snow will develop through mid-morning with snow rates near 1 inch per hour possible in heavier snow. Snow-covered roads have already been reported from Cedar Rapids to Dubuque. Along and south of Highway 151 in Grant County, localized snow amounts greater than 6 inches are possible. A sharp decrease in snowfall amounts is expected on the northern edge of the band, located across the middle of Clayton County, Iowa and Grant County, Wisconsin. Continue to monitor the forecast for updates as heavy snow develops. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts possible, especially in Grant County. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
